definition: Satsuma, the name of a former feudal domain in Japan, and of a former province, a battleship, a district, a peninsula etc

sentences.english: Wallis Island is a long way west of Samoa.
sentences.chinese: 瓦立斯島位於薩摩亞羣島以西很遠的地方。

sentences.english: He reiterated the Samoan government's firm adherence to the one-China policy.
sentences.chinese: 薩摩亞政府將堅定恪守一箇中國政策。

sentences.english: The Sommerhaus Piu prefab is perfect for vacation homes or even full-time residences.
sentences.chinese: 薩摩豪斯建築是完美的度假居住點，甚至也適合定居。

sentences.english: But when American warships arrived in Samoa, so did a big storm.
sentences.chinese: 但當美國的軍艦到達薩摩來羣島時，遭遇到了大風暴。

sentences.english: Robert Louis Stevenson arrived in Samoa in 1889 and built a house at Vailima.
sentences.chinese: 作者在1889年抵達薩摩亞在那裏建了一座房子。

sentences.english: The third chapter describes the Samoan civil war of 1899.
sentences.chinese: 第三章敘述1899年的薩摩亞內戰。

sentences.english: Holmes: You are famous for popularizing your own brand of Samoan toothpaste.
sentences.chinese: 你是爲推行本身地品牌薩摩亞牙膏聞名。

sentences.english: Samoan culture is very different from most Western cultures.
sentences.chinese: 薩摩亞與西方在文化上很多地方差異非常大。

sentences.english: Satsuma porcelain ware is produced in the city, which is also a major port. Population, 530, 496.
sentences.chinese: 該市出產薩摩瓷器，也是主要港口之一。

sentences.english: 1976 - Samoa becomes a member of the UN.
sentences.chinese: 1976年的今天，薩摩亞成爲聯合國成員國。

sentences.english: They were taken to Kagoshima,seat of the Satsuma clan.
sentences.chinese: 他們被帶到了薩摩藩的領地鹿兒島。

sentences.english: "How many kids, Bill?" Mr. Summers asked formally.
sentences.chinese: “比爾，你有幾個孩子？”薩摩斯正式發問。

definition: cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
to breed (livestock, fish, crops etc)/to grow/to raise
jianbing, a savory Chinese crêpe/pancake/CL:張|张[zhang1]
